intro: Chrysopsis oregona var. scaberrima, commonly known as the rough chrysopsis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow daisy-like flowers. The plant has hairy, rough-textured leaves that are typically gray-green in color. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and sagebrush steppe. This variant is distinguished by its unique leaf texture and is a hardy species adapted to arid environments.
